metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22824 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
defineAttribute in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has aninteger overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm4
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm4
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm4').
cmake: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
